title: Farm Scale Permaculture: Techniques Practices and Philosophies for Permanent Agricultural Systems

tasks.task: Attend a permaculture design webinar with a focus on farm-scale techniques.
subtasks: Welcome and introduction by the moderator, Jessi Schmidt.
Presenter, Keith Morris, shares his background in permaculture design and education.
Presenter explains the concept of permaculture and its ethical foundation (Earth care, People care, Fair share).
Discuss the importance of long-term planning using historical aerial photographs of the presenter’s farm.
Explore various aspects of permaculture design process including goals articulation, site analysis, and design concepts.
Explain the significance of climate analysis, considering current trends and future projections in permaculture design.
Assess landform and topography using site-specific tools and techniques (e.g., topographic maps, microtopography surveys).
Address the importance of water management and soil conservation strategies (e.g., keyline design, water catchment systems).
Evaluate vegetation and wildlife habitats to inform ecological design choices and analogies.
Introduce the concept of productive buffers and long-term land use planning.
Emphasize the importance of zones of use in farm layout and design.
Encourage attendees to utilize resources like permacultureprinciples.com and the presenter’s website for further study and application.
